headline: Pilot Energy pivots Western Australian solar project to hybrid BESS in AU$10.75 million deal
summary_80w: Oil and gas explorer Pilot Energy has entered into a binding head of agreement with SN Energy Australia for the joint development of a new solar-plus-storage project at Three Springs, Western Australia.

headline: Western Australia prioritises long-duration energy storage in latest clean energy funding round
summary_80w: Western Australia has launched the fourth round of its Clean Energy Innovation Grants programme, prioritising long-duration energy storage.

headline: Australia’s 1,770MWh Eraring Battery 1 commences commercial operations
summary_80w: Origin Energy has announced the commercial commencement of the 1,770MWh Eraring Battery 1 in New South Wales, Australia.

headline: World’s first gigawatt-hour-scale flow battery project goes into operation in China
summary_80w: Technology provider Dalian Rongke Power (Rongke Power) and infrastructure developer China Three Gorges Corporation (CTG) have brought online the world’s first gigawatt-hour-scale flow battery energy storage project.

headline: China to introduce stronger IP protections for solar PV
summary_80w: The Chinese government has released a range of policy measures to strengthen intellectual property (IP) protections in the country’s solar PV industry.

headline: Seven-bank syndicate backs Potentia Energy’s AU$830 million renewables expansion in Australia
summary_80w: Potentia Energy has raised AU$830 million in portfolio financing to support its renewable energy operations and development across Australia.

headline: Trinasolar secures solar PV module and tracker supply deals with ACWA Power
summary_80w: Leading Chinese module manufacturer Trinasolar has announced two new agreements with ACWA Power for projects in Saudi Arabia.

headline: 200MW Colombian PV project given environmental green light
summary_80w: The Colombian National Environmental Licensing Authority (ANLA) has granted environmental approval to a 200MW solar PV project in the Chiriguaná area of Northern Colombia.

headline: Consumers Energy starts operations at 250MW Michigan solar PV project
summary_80w: US utility Consumers Energy has started operations at its 250MW Muskegon solar PV project, its largest in the US state of Michigan.

headline: UNSW: Up to one-fifth of solar PV modules degrade 1.5 times faster than average
summary_80w: Up to one-fifth of solar PV modules degrade 1.5 times faster than average, according to new research from the University of New South Wales.

headline: SolarMax secures two EPC agreements for 400MWh total BESS capacity in Puerto Rico
summary_80w: Solar company SolarMax Technology’s wholly owned subsidiary, SolarMax Renewable Energy Provider, has entered into two engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) agreements for battery energy storage systems (BESS) in Puerto Rico.

headline: Utilities SRP and ED3 seeking offtake deal for esVolta’s newly-approved 3.2GWh Arizona BESS
summary_80w: The Board of Supervisors (BoS) for Arizona’s Pinal County has given the go-ahead to developer and IPP esVolta to construct 3.2GWh BESS within its unincorporated territory, and two utilities are in talks to procure some of its capacity.

headline: 2025 concludes with 1.5GWh+ of European BESS project completions, financing and supply deals
summary_80w: It's our first week back to normal service so here's a roundup of the past few weeks of BESS action in Europe, with projects moving forward in Romania, Denmark, UK, France, Spain, Albania, Germany and Austria.

headline: India’s biggest solar manufacturer Waaree raises funds toward 20GWh energy storage factory
summary_80w: An energy storage subsidiary of Waaree Energies has raised INR10 billion (US$110.9 million) for a planned manufacturing plant in India.

headline: AER: 244 community battery storage systems now connected across Australia
summary_80w: The Australian Energy Regulator (AER) has confirmed that 244 community battery energy storage systems (BESS) are now connected to the country's distribution networks.

headline: Full-scope integration: The forgotten advantage in Australia’s energy storage race
summary_80w: In this blog, Kashish Shah, market development manager at Wärtsilä Energy Storage, argues that Australia's complex battery storage market makes full-scope integration the most viable path for successful project delivery.

headline: Australian battery storage projects attract international lenders in year-end financing spree
summary_80w: Atmos Renewables and Potentia Energy have secured financing packages for their Australian renewables and energy storage portfolios.

headline: BRUC raises US$554 million to refinance debt, add storage to 858MW Spanish solar PV portfolio
summary_80w: BRUC has raised €474 million (US$554 million) to facilitate the addition of BESS to an 858MW Spanish solar portfolio.

headline: Why quality assurance in PV cell procurement matters more than ever
summary_80w: Don Cowan and Mahyar Mohammadnezhad of Kiwa PI Berlin explain the importance of upstream diligence in ensuring long-term PV performance.

headline: Genneia starts operations at 140MW solar PV plant in Argentina
summary_80w: Argentinian renewables developer Genneia has reached commercial operations at its 140MW Parque Solar San Rafael in Argentina.

headline: Nofar Energy to buy 1GW US solar portfolio from bankrupt Pine Gate
summary_80w: Israeli renewable energy developer Nofar Energy will acquire an almost 1GW US utility-scale solar portfolio from bankrupt IPP Pine Gate Renewables.

headline: Inox acquires 250MW solar PV portfolio from SunSource, in talks for further 50MW
summary_80w: Independent power producer Inox Clean Energy has acquired an operational solar PV portfolio in India from SunSource Energy.

headline: Codelco bags US$600 million towards 100% renewables target
summary_80w: The Chilean copper mining firm Codelco has secured US$600 million in climate financing to support its plans to fully decarbonise its energy supply.

headline: India adds record 35GW+ solar PV in 2025
summary_80w: Solar PV installations in India have surged in 2025 with a record 34.98GW of new additions, according to the Indian Ministry of New and Renewable Energy.

headline: Google acquires data centre and energy developer Intersect for US$4.75 billion
summary_80w: Google parent company Alphabet has announced a definitive agreement to acquire Intersect Power.

headline: Engie asks CEC to pause review of 1GWh Compass Energy Storage project in order to consider alternative sites
summary_80w: In a surprising move, the North American development arm of Engie has asked the California Energy Commission (CEC) to pause the review of its Compass Energy Storage project destined for Orange County, in order to assess alternative development sites.

headline: Zelestra’s solar-plus-storage Spain offtake deal is ‘PPA 2.0’, firm says
summary_80w: IPP Zelestra and utility EDP's recent PPA deal for a solar-plus-storage project in Spain was the first of its kind in Europe and 'moves the market forward', a Zelestra executive told Energy-Storage.news.

headline: India: KPI Group, POWERGRID win VGF-supported BESS tenders in Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh
summary_80w: Wins in competitive solicitations for large-scale battery storage projects in India have been announced by KPI Green Energy Ltd and Power Grid Corporation of India in the past few days.

headline: State legislative support for US community solar: Ampion on policy changes in 2025 and 2026
summary_80w: PV Tech spoke to Vihann Kong of Ampion about its work in 2025 and positive state-level legislation the sector can expect to see in 2026.

headline: Germany installed 16.2GW solar PV in 2025
summary_80w: Germany has installed 16.2GW of solar PV in 2025, according to an analysis by the Fraunhofer Institute for Solar Energy Systems (ISE) based on the energy-charts.info data platform.

headline: Canadian Solar appoints Colin Parkin as president, replacing Shawn Qu
summary_80w: Canadian Solar has appointed Colin Parkin to its presidency to replace Dr Shawn Qu, who will remain as the company’s chairman and CEO.

headline: SJVN commissions 1GW solar PV project in India
summary_80w: SJVN has commissioned a 1GW solar PV plant in Rajasthan, India, its largest solar project to comply with India’s DCR rules.

headline: Spain launches €355 million renewables manufacturing programme
summary_80w: The Spanish Ministry of Ecological Transition (MITECO) has launched a new renewables manufacturing subsidy programme.

headline: PV Tech’s top five Premium stories of the year in 2025
summary_80w: As the year comes to an end, we bring you a recap of the most-read Premium stories that have been published throughout 2025.

headline: Voltalia constructing hybrid renewables-plus-storage ‘cluster’ in Uzbekistan
summary_80w: French renewable energy power producer Voltalia has begun construction of its Artemisya “strategic cluster” project in Uzbekistan, Central Asia.

headline: India introduces 20% domestic content rule for Viability Gap Funding of battery storage
summary_80w: The Indian government has made a significant ruling on the Viability Gap Funding (VGF) scheme supporting battery storage projects.

headline: PV Price Watch: Prices of China’s PV wafers, cells, and modules rise in tandem, module quotes hit RMB0.70/W
summary_80w: The Chinese PV industry has witnessed a wave of collective price hikes across the supply chain, from wafers, solar cells, to modules, with prices rising to varying degrees.

headline: Bahrain has begun building 100MW Al Dur solar PV project
summary_80w: The government of Bahrain has laid the foundation stone for a 100MW solar power plant in the Al Dur area of the Southern Governorate.

headline: PV Tech’s top ten stories of the year in 2025
summary_80w: As the year comes to an end, we bring you a recap of the most-read stories throughout 2025, with the US taking most of the spotlight.

headline: ‘Green tech for a shared future’: LONGi launches global clean energy projects at COP30
summary_80w: LONGi hosted a 'green tech for a shared future' event at COP30, which emphasised the importance of the integration of renewable technologies.

headline: INDIA ROUND-UP: KP Group invests in Botswana, Premier and Waaree sign supply deals
summary_80w: Premier Energies and Waaree have both won module supply orders, while KP Group has signed a MoU with the Government of Botswana.

headline: T1 Energy completes first tax credit sale, valued at US$160 million
summary_80w: T1 Energy has completed its first sale of Section 45X production tax credits (PTCs) in a deal valued at US$160 million.

headline: Potential for ‘mid-sized’ installers in 2026: Tigo Energy on the US distributed solar sector
summary_80w: PV Tech spoke to JD Dillon of Tigo Energy about its work across different scales of solar operation in the US.

headline: For thermal batteries, continuous delivery matters more than peak temperature
summary_80w: We need to think more deeply about thermal energy storage as a pathway to industrial decarbonisation and managing electricity costs, writes Pasquale Romano, CEO of Redoxblox.

headline: Massachusetts selects 1.2GW of BESS through RFP
summary_80w: Massachusetts’s Department of Energy Resources (DOER) has completed the evaluation of bids received in response to the Section 83E Storage request for proposals (RFP), selecting projects totalling 1,268MW of energy storage capacity.

headline: Year in Review: Jinko on leveraging a global solar brand to compete in ‘transformational’ 2025
summary_80w: Anita Li, vice president of Jinko ESS, reflects on a ‘transformational year’ in which the energy storage arm of the vertically integrated solar manufacturer continued to expand.

headline: Sembcorp expands India footprint with 300MW solar acquisition from ReNew
summary_80w: Sembcorp has acquired a 100% stake in ReNew Sun Bright for approximately US$191.6 million, through its subsidiary, Sembcorp Green Infra.

headline: The PV Review, 2025: Green shoots for US polysilicon production
summary_80w: The PV Review, 2025: Three companies have made headlines for their efforts, and failures, to produce polysilicon in the US this year.

headline: Greenwood reaches financial close for 52MWp solar project in Colombia
summary_80w: Greenwood Energy has reached financial close for the first phase of its 52MWp Terra Site I solar project in Colombia.

headline: CHN Energy starts full operations at 1GW floating solar project in China
summary_80w: CHN Energy has started full commercial operations at the 1GW HG14 floating PV (FPV) project off the coast of Dongying in China.

headline: Fortis Energy invites EPC bids for 75MW solar-plus-storage project in Albania
summary_80w: Fortis Energy has begun the construction phase of the 75MW Ersekë solar PV project in Albania, which is co-located with a BESS.

headline: Year in Review: EPC Burns & McDonnell on data centre demand, FEOC and energy density
summary_80w: The renewables and energy storage teams at US EPC firm Burns & McDonnell tackle our annual Year in Review Q&A series.

headline: Metlen completes sale of 1.6GWh Chile solar-plus-storage portfolio to Glenfarne Group
summary_80w: Energy and infrastructure investor Glenfarne Group has bought a portfolio of solar PV and co-located BESS projects in Chile from Greece-headquartered firm Metlen Energy & Metals.

summary_80w: The Glenfarne Group has acquired a portfolio of solar PV and co-located BESS assets in Chile from Metlen Energy & Metals.

headline: Mexico awards 3.3GW renewables, 2.6GW solar PV, capacity
summary_80w: Mexico has awarded 3.3GW of renewable energy capacity, of which solar PV will account for 2.6GW of capacity.

headline: The race is on for US solar developers to reach ‘safe harbour’

headline: Saatvik commissions 2GW EPE film manufacturing line in India
summary_80w: Saatvik Green Energy has successfully commissioned and operationalised a 2GW EPE film manufacturing facility at its Ambala plant in Haryana.

headline: Solar-plus-storage ‘gaining importance’ in European dealmaking: BayWa r.e. on Europe’s investment landscape
summary_80w: PV Tech spoke to Daniel Parsons about BayWa r.e.'s European dealmaking in 2025 and the role of co-located renewable energy plus BESS.

headline: PGE receives regulatory approval to increase price of 1GW BESS portfolio, ‘significant changes’ to tariffs and ITC to blame
summary_80w: Investor-owned utility (IOU) Portland General Electric (PGE) has become the latest US entity to reveal the impact of changes to import tariffs and tax credits recently implemented by the Federal Government.

headline: A year of insights: Energy-Storage.news webinars in 2025
summary_80w: It’s been a bumper year for sponsored webinars here at Energy-Storage.news, and here is a selection to round out 2025.

headline: The PV Review, 2025: A year of turbulence in the US, from an ‘Energy Emergency’ to FEOC
summary_80w: The PV Review, 2025: A look back over a turbulent year in US solar policy changes, from the 'Big, Beautiful Bill' to tariff challenges.

headline: ‘Turbulence and legislative hurdles’ cloud the picture for US solar: SolarEdge on policy challenges in 2025
summary_80w: PV Tech spoke to Marty Rogers of SolarEdge about how US policy rulings and policy uncertainty affected his company's work in 2025.

headline: Alphabet to acquire Intersect for US$4.75 billion
summary_80w: Alphabet has announced a definitive agreement to acquire data centre and energy infrastructure solutions provider Intersect for US$4.75 billion in cash.

headline: CPV Renewable commissions 160MW solar plant in Maryland
summary_80w: CPV Renewable Power and Harrison Street Asset Management (HSAM) have begun commercial operations at its 160MW solar project located in Garrett County, Maryland.

headline: Michigan utilities awarded financial damages for work performed on pumped hydro plant
summary_80w: A jury has found in favour of Consumers Energy and DTE Energy in their case against Toshiba for “defective” work to upgrade a pumped hydro facility.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Hydrostor A-CAES project, Hawaiian Electric on Maui, Peregrine picks Wärtsilä for 500MWh Texas BESS
summary_80w: In this Energy-Storage.news roundup, Hydrostor receives permitting approval for its California project, Hawaiian Electric is set to begin construction on a Maui battery energy storage system (BESS) and Peregrine and Wärtsilä advance construction of a Texas BESS.

headline: Energy-Storage.news most-read news stories of the year 2025
summary_80w: As we welcome the end of another year and greet the next, here are the top 10 most-read news stories from 2025.

headline: Revenue trends, supply chains and emerging markets: Energy-Storage.news 2025 Guest Blog picks, Part 2
summary_80w: Our selection of Guest Blogs published over the past year continues, featuring entries from July to December.

headline: Pacifico Energy aims to prove subsidy-free BESS in Japan ‘demonstrates competitive returns’
summary_80w: “A multi-stream revenue stacking model” made it possible for Pacifico Energy to self-fund a new grid-scale battery storage project in Japan.

headline: Policy storms ahead, fire safety and data centres: Energy-Storage.news 2025 Guest Blog picks, Part 1
summary_80w: As 2025 draws to a close, here’s a look back at a selection of Guest Blog contributions published by Energy-Storage.news over the past 12 months.

headline: The PV Review, 2025: China tackles module oversupply, creating cautious optimism ahead of 2026
summary_80w: The PV Review, 2025: The culmination of years of oversupply of Chinese modules caused module prices to fall, slashing manufacturers’ profits.

headline: 134MWdc solar project in North Macedonia backed by EBRD and KfW
summary_80w: EBRD and KfW will provide €87 million (US$102.2 million) in debt financing for a 134MWdc solar project in North Macedonia.

headline: Solar cybersecurity goes ‘mainstream’: SolarPower Europe chair talks cybersecurity trends in 2025 and 2026
summary_80w: PV Tech spoke to Uri Sadot about how security concerns finally went 'mainstream' in 2025, and what can be done to improve solar cybersecurity.

headline: ArcelorMittal commits US$903 million to three solar, wind and energy storage projects in India
summary_80w: ArcelorMittal is investing INR81 billion (US$903 million) in three renewable energy projects across three states in India.

headline: Saatvik Solar secures solar module order worth US$54.2 million
summary_80w: Saatvik Green Energy, through its subsidiary Saatvik Solar Industries, has secured solar PV module orders worth INR4.8 billion (US$54.2 million).

headline: Researchers tackle TOPCon ‘efficiency-cost-bifaciliaty trilemma’
summary_80w: Chinese researchers have developed a process to boost the efficiency and bifacial performance of TOPCon solar cells while reducing silver consumption.

headline: New Orleans approves US$30 million virtual power plant programme to support grid resilience
summary_80w: The New Orleans, Louisiana, US City Council voted unanimously to approve a US$28 million virtual power plant (VPP) programme, reportedly, the first distributed energy resource (DER) programme in the city.

headline: How to navigate volatility in ERCOT: Ascend Analytics
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium speaks with CEO of optimisation platform provider Ascend Analytics, Dr. Gary Dorris, PhD, about navigating ERCOT’s revenue opportunities and the implementation of RTC+B.

headline: VIDEO: Discover how New York powers energy storage innovation
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with NYSERDA, 'Discover how New York powers energy storage innovation'.

headline: Operational risk, optimisation, data, tolls and more: Battery Asset Management Summit Europe key takeaways
summary_80w: The Battery Asset Management Summit Europe earlier this month brought together operators, optimisers, software and hardware suppliers and more to discuss the big topics in BESS risk management, operation, commercialisation and optimisation. Read on for a summary of the key talking points.

headline: Can US trade policy deliver a domestic battery supply chain?
summary_80w: Building US domestic energy storage manufacturing capacity will require more than limiting foreign participation, writes Aaron Marks of Intertek CEA.

headline: China files WTO solar subsidy complaint against India
summary_80w: The Chinese government has lodged a complaint against India with the World Trade Organization over alleged subsidies to its solar industry.

headline: European Energy wins approval for 1.1GW solar project in Australia
summary_80w: European Energy has secured approval for its 1.1GW Upper Calliope solar project in Queensland near Gladstone, Australia.

headline: Emmvee expands manufacturing with 2.5GW 6GW module line, announces 6GW solar cell and module facility
summary_80w: Emmvee, through its subsidiary Emmvee Energy, has begun operations at its 2.5GW solar module manufacturing plant in Bengaluru, Karnataka.

headline: Australian utility Flow Power closes financing on its first BESS project, in Victoria’s Latrobe Valley
summary_80w: Renewable energy generator and retailer Flow Power has achieved financial close on a 100MW/223MWh battery storage project in Victoria, Australia.

headline: BESS wins in Poland capacity market falls for the first time, de-rating cut to blame
summary_80w: The results of Poland's capacity market (CM) were announced this week, with fewer awards to BESS than last year because of a reduction in the technology's de-rating factor.

headline: NYPA to develop 1.2GW of additional storage as part of renewed energy plan, in face of ‘strong federal headwinds’
summary_80w: The board of trustees for New York Power Authority (NYPA) last week gave the greenlight for the public power organisation to develop an additional 1.2GW of storage as part of its renewed Strategic Plan for New Renewable Energy Generation.

headline: Egypt: AMEA Power secures IFC funds for ‘Africa’s largest single-site renewables and battery project’
summary_80w: The World Bank’s International Finance Corporation has agreed a financing package for a 1GW solar PV power plant paired with 600MWh of energy storage in Egypt.

headline: Australian government supports additional 40GWh of Cheaper Home Batteries by 2030
summary_80w: The Australian government has expanded the nationwide Cheaper Home Batteries Program, which has seen rapid uptake from homeowners.

headline: GridStor executes tolling agreement for Texas BESS, CPS Energy launches 500MW BESS RFP
summary_80w: Two US companies, GridStor, and CPS Energy are making advancements on Texas energy storage deployments, with GridStor executing a tolling agreement and CPS Energy issuing a new request for proposals.

headline: California CCA throws support behind two thermal battery storage startup developers
summary_80w: California Community Choice Aggregator (CCA) Clean Power Alliance (CPA) last week (8 December 2025) moved one step closer to executing agreements for offtake with two companies developing innovative thermal battery storage projects.

headline: US virtual power plant programmes advance with new partnerships and investment
summary_80w: Distributed energy resources (DERs) are emerging as potential solutions for consumers seeking independence and relief from rising energy costs.

headline: ‘Evolving revenue mix, harsh Nordic operating conditions’: Hitachi Energy supplies PCS to Finland’s largest BESS
summary_80w: Finland’s largest BESS to date will need to cope with “especially challenging” operating conditions and stringent and evolving grid code requirements.

headline: Sungrow and Algihaz’ 7.8GWh Saudi Arabia BESS connected to grid
summary_80w: Three BESS projects totalling 7.8GWh in Saudi Arabia have been connected to the electricity grid, technology provider Sungrow said.

headline: Queensland government says it, not councils, will decide on battery storage projects in Australian state
summary_80w: New laws went into effect last week in Queensland, Australia, that mean large-scale battery storage project applications must be dealt with at the state level.

headline: European BESS: 800MW of project awards, M&A and financing announced across continent
summary_80w: It's been a busy few weeks in the run-up to Christmas in Europe's BESS project space, with M&A, final investment decisions (FID) and supplier deals in Germany, Belgium, Portugal, Italy, Finland, Romania and the UK totally around 800MW of capacity.

headline: ERCOT BESS revenue ‘roller coaster’ is a feature, not a bug
summary_80w: In an upcoming conversation with Energy-Storage.news Premium and Optimisation platform provider Ascend Analytics, CEO Dr. Gary Dorris PhD, discusses the ‘roller coaster’ revenues of the Electric Reliability Council of Texas (ERCOT) market.

headline: US energy storage installations in 2025 have already surpassed last year’s total: Wood Mac
summary_80w: According to the Q4 2025 US Energy Storage Monitor from Wood Mackenzie Power & Renewables and the American Clean Power Association (ACP), 2025 energy storage installations surpassed 2024 capacity.

headline: How thermal energy storage (TES) makes steam from renewables economically viable
summary_80w: Thermal energy storage can make steam for chemical industries and manufacturing economically viable, writes Martin Schichtel, CEO and Founder of Kraftblock.

headline: Akuo Energy, Voltalia kick off projects in French overseas territories New Caledonia, French Guiana
summary_80w: Renewable energy companies Akuo Energy and Voltalia have begun constructing projects in French overseas territories.
